article.headline: Norfolk St. 76, Jacksonville St. 72
article.story: JACKSONVILLE, Ala. (AP) -- Corey Lyons scored 21 points and Tony Murphy added 19 to help Norfolk State snap a four-game losing streak in a 76-72 win over Jacksonville State on Saturday. The Spartans (3-8) went on a 12-1 run in the first half before taking a 33-27 halftime lead. They claimed their first double-digit lead in the second half at 39-28 on a put back by Larry Vickers, who scored 12 points. Corey Lyons, who finished with 12 points, scored on a fastbreak layup with 9:44 left to give Norfolk State a 60-40 lead. The Gamecocks (2-10) answered by making four of their nine 3-pointers over the next six minutes to cut the lead to four points. But the Spartans pulled away down the stretch, hitting 9-of-11 shots from the free throw line. Murphy, who shot 9-of-10 from the line, grabbed six rebounds, had three assists and five steals for Norfolk State. Jacksonville State guard Nick Murphy had a team-leading 17 points and 10 rebounds. Will Ginn and J.J. Wesley scored 14 points apiece, while Amadou Mbodji added 10 for the Gamecocks who have lost seven straight games.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
